actions.text: Reported to Senate from the Committee on Foreign Relations, S. Rept. 94-19.

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 94-41.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: An original resolution to authorize the Senate to respond to official invitations received from foreign governments or parliamentary bodies and associations.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Authorizes the President of the Senate to appoint members of delegations to respond to invitations from foreign governments or parliamentary bodies or associations, and to designate their chairman or cochairmen. States the expenses of each delegation shall include those deemed appropriate by the chairman to carry out the purposes of this resolution, including reimbursements to any agency of the Government for: (1) expenses incurred on behalf of each delegation; (2) compensation (including overtime) of employees officially detailed to each delegation; and (3) expenses incurred in connection with providing appropriate hospitality to foreign delegates.

titles.title: An original resolution to authorize the Senate to respond to official invitations received from foreign governments or parliamentary bodies and associations.
